articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Eleven people were killed in a suspected arson attack on a bar in the northern Mexican border city of San Luis Colorado after an expelled patron set it ablaze with a Molotov cocktail, authorities in the state of Sonora said on Saturday.
articles.title: Eleven killed in suspected arson attack on bar in northern Mexico

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British band The 1975 said on Sunday they has cancelled shows in Taiwan and Muslim-majority Indonesia, a day after Malaysia banned them from performing there after their frontman kissed a bandmate on stage and criticised the country's anti-LGBT laws.
articles.title: UK band The 1975 cancels Indonesia, Taiwan shows after Malaysia LGBT controversy

articles.author: Simon Lewis, David Brunnstrom
articles.description: It has never been easy for the United States to secure the return of citizens from North Korea, one of the world's most isolated nations.
articles.title: Bringing Private King home: reaching Pyongyang is the first challenge

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: At least four people were killed and several others injured on Saturday after a hot water pipe burst at a shopping mall in western Moscow, the city's mayor said.
articles.title: At least four killed at Moscow mall after hot water pipe bursts

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russian tennis player Vera Zvonareva was blocked from entering Poland for reasons of state security and public safety, the Polish interior ministry said on Saturday.
articles.title: Russian player Zvonareva blocked from entering Poland

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Ghana's sanitation minister resigned on Saturday over reports staff found and stole stashes of local and foreign money from her home, she said in a letter to the president in which she denied any wrongdoing.
articles.title: Ghana sanitation minister resigns over alleged stashed cash

articles.author: Rozanna Latiff
articles.description: Malaysia's government halted a music festival in the capital Kuala Lumpur on Saturday, a day after the frontman of British pop rock band The 1975 kissed a male bandmate onstage and criticised the country's anti-LGBT laws.
articles.title: Malaysia halts music festival after same-sex kiss by UK band The 1975

articles.author: David Ljunggren
articles.description: The heaviest rain to hit the Atlantic Canadian province of Nova Scotia in more than 50 years triggered floods causing "unimaginable" damage, and four people are missing, including two children, officials said on Saturday.
articles.title: Nova Scotia floods cause 'unimaginable' damage; four people missing

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A drone attack on an ammunition depot in Crimea prompted authorities to evacuate everyone in a five-km (3.1-mile) radius and briefly suspend road traffic on the bridge linking the peninsula to Russia, the Moscow-installed regional governor said on Saturday.
articles.title: Crimea drone attack prompts evacuation, brief bridge closure

articles.author: Indranil Sarkar, Aby Koilparambil
articles.description: U.S. big-bike maker Harley-Davidson (HOG.N) and British rival Triumph have revved up India's premium motorcycle market with aggressively priced models that analysts said could dent the over half-century dominance of local champion Royal Enfield.
articles.title: Analysis: Harley-Davidson, Triumph in first gear of challenge to Royal Enfield's India reign
